metadata.title: Convert US Gallons to Liters – Volume Converter
metadata.description: Convert volume from US Gallons to Liters (L), essential for fuel, cooking, and liquid measurements.

introduction: This converter transforms volume measurements from US Gallons to Liters, enabling fuel and liquid volume understanding.
The US gallon is used for fuel in the US while most of the world uses liters. Understanding the conversion is essential.
This converter uses the standard relationship where 1 US gallon equals approximately 3.78541 liters.
methodology: 1 US gallon ≈ 3.78541 liters. To convert gallons to liters, multiply by 3.78541. For example, 1 gal ≈ 3.79 L, 10 gal ≈ 37.9 L.
Fuel economy is measured in miles per gallon in the US but liters per 100 km elsewhere. Converting enables comparison.
Cooking recipes use different volume measurements depending on region. Understanding conversions helps with recipe scaling.
This converter provides precise volume conversions for culinary and fuel contexts.
examples: Example 1 – Fuel: A 15-gallon fuel tank holds approximately 56.8 liters.
Example 2 – Cooking: A 1-gallon recipe container holds approximately 3.79 liters.
Example 3 – Beverage: A 2-gallon pitcher holds approximately 7.57 liters.

faqs.question: What is the conversion from US Gallons to Liters?
faqs.answer: 1 US gallon ≈ 3.78541 L. Multiply gallons by 3.78541 to get liters.

faqs.question: What is the difference between US and UK gallons?
faqs.answer: 1 US gallon ≈ 3.785 liters. 1 UK gallon ≈ 4.546 liters. UK gallons are larger.
